election_record.label: Massachusetts 1808 Selectman, Portland

overview.note: "MARCH MEETING .... We learn that the choice of Selectmen has just been declared. The Federal Ticket succeeded over the democratic and embargo ticket, by a majority of 172! The highest number of the Federal Ticket was 408; on that of the democratic, 236." Portland Gazette, and Maine Advertizer (Portland, ME). March 28, 1808.

"More Good News From Maine. Portland March 28, 1808. Mr. Russell - This date came on the choice of Town Officers. The meeting was full; much exertion was made on both sides; when, very much to the credit of the Federalist, they succeeded in electing Federal Selectmen (in the room of the late democratic board) by a majority of One hundred and Eighty-five. for the federal ticket 408, Democratic 223." Columbian Centinel. Massachusetts Federalist (Boston, MA). March 30, 1808.

election_record.reference: Portland Gazette, and Maine Advertizer (Portland, ME). March 28, 1808.
